div.p: With dynamic drilldown you can define custom destinations to link to when a user clicks on fields in a dashboard or form. The value captured by the click is passed to the destination. The destination can be another dashboard, form, or view within your Splunk installation or an external web page.

The following panels list sourcetype throughput as a table. You can define destinations that open another form, passing in the sourcetype clicked. You can also pass the value of what is clicked to a web page, such as the web page for Splunk Answers.
Use a <link> tag within a <drilldown> tag to specify a custom destination.

li.p: Use a relative path to connect to a dashboard:
Use a relative path to connect to a form, passing in a token to populate the form:
Use a URL and query argument to pass a value to the destination page:

div.p: There are various ways to capture a value from a dashboard (or form) and pass the value to the destination. Use the field or series attribute to the <link> tag to specify which values to capture. For more information on capturing values and other dynamic drilldown features, refer to the Splunk documentation:

table.title: High CPU processors (Dynamic drilldown to a form)
table.searchString: index="_internal" source="*metrics.log" group="pipeline" | chart sum(cpu_seconds) over processor | sort -sum(cpu_seconds) | rename sum(cpu_seconds) as "Total CPU Seconds"
